intro: Casearia mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius casearia, is a shrub or small tree native to the Mascarene Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers followed by yellowish-orange berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal and lowland areas. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
